title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When following the steps in 1GEWMOZ to reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new basic project. 2. Create a new file named test.xml. By default, the scripted resource editor example is used as the editor for XML files. 3. Select test.xml in the Navigator. 4. Choose 'Open With...' and select 'Default Text Editor'. 5. Nothing happens and the scripted resource editor example remains active. It should open a new editor on the file, as the editor type is different.
EB: When following the steps in 1GEWMOZ to reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new basic project. 2. Create a new file named test.xml. By default, the scripted resource editor example is used as the editor for XML files. 3. Select test.xml in the Navigator. 4. Choose 'Open With...' and select 'Default Text Editor'. 5. The file should open in a new editor, as the editor type is different.
SR: 1. Create a new basic project. 2. Create a new file with an XML extension. 3. In the Navigator, select the newly created file. 4. Right-click and choose 'Open With...'. 5. From the context menu, select 'Default Text Editor'. Observe whether the file opens in a new editor or if the existing editor is reactivated.
